Summary: To estimate ratios of market values (equity and firm) to book value (equity and firm), with companion variables (ROE and ROC)
Vars: Number of firms in the industry grouping.
Aggregated net income divided by aggregated book value of equity, across all firms in the group.
Measure of returns to equity investors, based upon stated net income
Aggregate net income, adjusted for R&D, divided by aggregated book value of equity, adjusted for capitalized R&D, across companies in group.
Measure of returns to equity investors, based upon stated net income, adjusted for R&D being capitalized.
table_summary: This table provides an analysis of the Return on Equity (ROE) for various industries. It includes the number of firms in each industry and their ROE values, both unadjusted and adjusted for R&D expenses. The data helps in understanding the financial performance of different sectors, highlighting which industries are more profitable and which are experiencing losses.
